name: Applewood Smoked Sea Salt
description: Utilizes sweet applewood from the Yakima Valley to fuel the fires that smoke this sea salt.  Aged applewood, one of the most popular of fruit woods used in smoking, creates a delicious, savory flavor

name: Black Truffle Sea Salt
description: Black truffles, expertly blended with naturally pure, fine quality sea salt.  Lends an earthy sophistication to egg dishes, potatoes, red meat and even pasta.  Sprinkle on popcorn with Buttery olive oil.

name: Cyprus Black Lava Sea Salt
description: Mediterranean, pyramid-shaped crystal sea salt flakes combined with activated charcoal (natural detoxifier).  Dramatic color and texture make it an ideal finishing salt.

name: Cyprus Flake Sea Salt
description: Large pyramid-shaped light and fluffy salt crystals, mild in flavor.  Flake salt is often specifically called for in certain recipes, but can be used in any dish.

name: Espresso Brava Sea Salt
description: Fuses espresso with sea salt, not only a delicious addition to chocolates and desserts, but also a complement for rubs and marinades for beef or pork.  A delicious match with a cognac reduction, or anything with nutmeg, anise, vanilla,  or cherry.

name: Fleur de Sel (Guérande, France)
description: "Flower of Salt", also known as "Caviar of Salt", accepted by chefs as the world’s best finishing salt. The name comes from the aroma of violets that develops as the salt dries.  Best sprinkled over foods just before serving.

name: Lime Fresco Sea Salt
description: Tart without being sour.  Use to rim a drink glass (margaritas!), sprinkle on chicken, fish or shellfish before grilling, or add to a crisp salad for a surprising hint of citrus.

name: Matcha Sea Salt
description: Fused with powdered premium green tea leaves from Japan.  Matcha is rich in antioxidants and is becoming a new gourmet taste sensation.  Try with scrambled eggs, steamed fish, bok choy, and soups ... and yes, even chocolate and desserts.

name: Spanish Rosemary Sea Salt
description: Delivers a straight-from-the-herb-garden flavor.  A perfect pairing with roasted potatoes.  Pork roasts benefit from its addition, and egg dishes are enlivened.

name: Sun-Ripened Tomato Sea Salt
description: Rich tomato flavor created by a process that incorporates the whole tomato.  Great for soups and sauces, or top a slice of crusty bread with unsalted butter and a sprinkling of this salt.

name: Thai Ginger Sea Salt
description: Combines the clean, simple flavor of sea salt with fresh ginger.  Use on grilled vegetables, Asian noodles or fish ... even love it on vanilla ice cream.

name: Vintage Merlot Sea Salt
description: Fusing full-bodied merlot and sea salt enriches gourmet meals with the sophisticated taste of wine. Perfectly suited for soups and sauces, and the lovely wine color makes it ideal for finishing dishes.

name: Wild Porcini Mushroom Sea Salt
description: Dried porcini mixed with sea salt has a concentrated flavor and mushroom aroma that is excellent in risotto, soups, and sauces.  Gives salmon a unique taste.

name: Herbs for Dipping
description: A blend of oregano, rosemary, sage and thyme, as well as onion, garlic, bell pepper and salt, creates a flavorful dipping oil.  Use 2 tbsp per 1/2 cup of olive oil, let stand for 30 minutes, and then dip your favorite bread.  Also good sprinkled on green vegetables.

name: Seasonello
description: A delicious and Italian way to add flavor to dishes.  Sea salt is paired with rosemary, garlic, sage and pepper.  Enriches meat, poultry, vegetables, and barbecue dishes.  Caution:  this one is addictive!

name: Ginger Infused Pure Cane Sugar
description: Powerful ginger flavor.  It’s perfect on grilled salmon and in Asian dishes calling for ginger.  Top lemon sorbet or pumpkin pie, caramelize on top of crème brûlée, or simply stir it into a cup of tea.

name: Green Chili Infused Pure Cane Sugar
description: Combines sweet and hot in a delicious way.  Add a dash to diced melon or pineapple chunks, sprinkle on chocolate ice cream or brownies, or stir into hot chocolate.   Also great sprinkled on pork or chicken before grilling.
